abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, as 2017 re-election campaign moves into full swing, faces voter scrutiny over mixed results of his tenure; has struggled with some signature efforts, like dealing with growing homeless population, but earned high scores on job creation and economic development, despite fact that those issues have not been priority his administration.
lead_paragraph: High-level departures from the city’s health and human services department are a sign of intractable problems, but the city’s economy is growing.
snippet: High-level departures from the city’s health and human services department are a sign of intractable problems, but the city’s economy is growing....

headline.main: As Progress Eludes Him on Social Issues, De Blasio Finds Success Elsewhere
headline.print_headline: Mayor Succeeds, Just Not on His Preferred Causes
